nodes.bodyText: Should we be doing a join here? Then if any component fails to start we throw an exception back up to BeaconNodeCommand (we should remove the try/catch in this class).  That in turn lets PicoCLI be notified of the failure properly.
Yay! Love seeing these move out of constructors.  Could easily be the source of your failing AT though as it will now miss events from the storage service at startup.
